Articles.Content:
So i have been trying to make a curiosity styled rover, but when i place the wheels on the body, this always happens.

Can anyone help me solve this problem?

Edited June 17, 2014 by GalaxiesFinestToday

You can use teh QWEASD keys to adjust the alignment of parts being attached. just pushing the key rotates the part 90 degrees, holding down shift when pressing the key rotates it less ( I think 5 degrees).
turn off angle snap. Use the C key!

Hold down the shift key and us the angle keys, (Q,E) to rotate them to the correct orientation.

Or try what Kenbob said.
Ok. The problem was i had angle snap on. Thank you all for helping.
Hey man, no problem. Just helpin' out a fellow KSP'er!
Building rovers is MUCH easier in the space plane hanger as you can have angle snapping on (which makes everything even) whilst keeping every wheel lined up
As SpenSpaceCorp said, build your rovers in the Space Plane Hangar. Just make sure you have an attachment point so you can save it as a subassembly, then import it into the VAB. Works every time!
That rover is gonna go round in a very small circle!
